SEARCH
Package gw.plugin.observability

Interface ObservabilityPlugin

All Superinterfaces:
InternalPlugin, Remote
public interface ObservabilityPlugin extends InternalPlugin

This plugin is used to record start, complete, failure, and error states for critical processes such as job quoting, and to record some of the more niche bits of information.

The default implementation should be sufficient for most usages. An implementation of the plugin should be thread-safe and should never throw an exception.

Note that, in almost all cases, a beforeProcessStart call should correspond to one (and only one) call to one of afterProcessComplete, onProcessFail, or onProcessError.

Here is an example of a typical usage of the ObservabilityPlugin:

   public void doAThingWithObservability() {
     ObservabilityPlugin observabilityPlugin = Plugins.get(ObservabilityPlugin.class);
     ObservabilityContext ctx = new ObservabilityContext()
       .withContext(...) // some context that will only be used in logs
       .withContextAndMetricTagContextKey(...); // some context that will be used in logs AND as a metric tag k/v
     observabilityPlugin.beforeProcessStart(MARKER.getName(), ctx);
     try {
       var result = doAThing();
       ctx.withContext(...); // some context that we only know after we're done
       if (result.isSuccess()) {
         observabilityPlugin.afterProcessComplete(MARKER.getName(), ctx);
       } else {
         observabilityPlugin.onProcessFail(MARKER.getName(), ctx);
       }
     } catch (Exception e) {
       ctx.withContext(...); // some extra context
       observabilityPlugin.onProcessError(MARKER.getName(), e, ctx);
       throw e; // optional
     } finally {
       // do some cleanup
     }
   }

Notice that, no matter what happens, we always call one of the three end states once we've called beforeProcessStart.

The only existing exception is when using ObservabilityContext.withStartTimeNs(java.lang.Long), which should be used sparingly. See its doc for details.

In most cases, please use the ObservabilityHandler instead of calling this class directly. It provides a cleaner and more robust interface which is suitable for most uses.

  • Method Details

    • configureMarkerDefaults

      default void configureMarkerDefaults(String markerName, MarkerConfig config)

      Configure default behaviors for a marker using developer-defined settings. All marker defaults are intended to be overridable by customers depending on their needs, but for now this is not supported.

      Currently, the only supported marker configuration is to indicate whether the plugin should log events on the given marker.

      See MarkerConfig for details on what each configuration option does and what its not-specified default values are.

      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker to be configured
      config - configuration settings for the marker

    • beforeProcessStart

      boolean beforeProcessStart(String markerName)
      Deprecated.
      Use beforeProcessStart(String, ObservabilityContext) instead.
      This can be called to record the start of a process.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • beforeProcessStart

      boolean beforeProcessStart(String markerName, LogMessageParams logMessageParams)
      Deprecated.
      Use beforeProcessStart(String, ObservabilityContext) instead.
      This can be called to record the start of a process.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      logMessageParams - LogMessageParams
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • beforeProcessStart

      default boolean beforeProcessStart(String markerName, ObservabilityContext context)

      This can be called to record the start of a process.

      The ObservabilityPluginImpl will log a start message and keep start time state for an expected afterProcessComplete(java.lang.String), onProcessFail(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), or onProcessError(java.lang.String, java.lang.Throwable) call, except where ObservabilityContext.withStartTimeNs(java.lang.Long) is used. See its doc for details on this.

      Please consider using the ObservabilityHandler instead of calling this method directly.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      context - ObservabilityContext
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • afterProcessComplete

      boolean afterProcessComplete(String markerName)
      Deprecated.
      Use afterProcessComplete(String, ObservabilityContext) instead.
      This can be called to record the end of a process that has completed successfully.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • afterProcessComplete

      boolean afterProcessComplete(String markerName, LogMessageParams logMessageParams)
      Deprecated.
      Use afterProcessComplete(String, ObservabilityContext) instead.
      This can be called to record the end of a process that has completed successfully.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      logMessageParams - LogMessageParams
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • afterProcessComplete

      default boolean afterProcessComplete(String markerName, ObservabilityContext context)

      This can be called to record the end of a process that has completed successfully.

      The ObservabilityPluginImpl will log a stop message using start time state recorded by beforeProcessStart(java.lang.String) except where ObservabilityContext.withStartTimeNs(java.lang.Long) is used. See its doc for details on this. If integrated with DataDog, it will send metrics with tags as defined by ObservabilityContext.

      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      context - ObservabilityContext
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • onProcessFail

      boolean onProcessFail(String markerName, String message)
      Deprecated.
      Use onProcessFail(String, ObservabilityContext) instead.

      This can be called to record the end of a process that has failed.

      A process failure is when a process finishes but did not successfully complete the attempted task. Errors may lead to failures, not but not all failures result from errors.

      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      message - a message about the failure.
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • onProcessFail

      boolean onProcessFail(String markerName, String message, LogMessageParams logMessageParams)
      Deprecated.
      Use onProcessFail(String, ObservabilityContext) instead.

      This can be called to record the end of a process that has failed.

      A process failure is when a process finishes but did not successfully complete the attempted task. Errors may lead to failures, not but not all failures result from errors.

      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      message - a message about the failure.
      logMessageParams - LogMessageParams
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • onProcessFail

      default boolean onProcessFail(String markerName, ObservabilityContext context)

      This can be called to record the end of a process that has failed.

      A process failure is when a process finishes but did not successfully complete the attempted task. Errors may lead to failures, not but not all failures result from errors.

      The ObservabilityPluginImpl will log a failure message using start time state recorded by beforeProcessStart(java.lang.String) except where ObservabilityContext.withStartTimeNs(java.lang.Long) is used. See its doc for details on this. If integrated with DataDog, it will send metrics with tags as defined by ObservabilityContext.

      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      context - ObservabilityContext
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • onProcessError

      boolean onProcessError(String markerName, Throwable throwable)
      Deprecated.
      Use onProcessError(String, Throwable, ObservabilityContext) instead.
      This can be called to record the end of a process that has errored. An error is when there is an unexpected problem that occurs in a process.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      throwable - the Throwable that occurred.
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • onProcessError

      boolean onProcessError(String markerName, Throwable throwable, LogMessageParams logMessageParams)
      Deprecated.
      Use onProcessError(String, Throwable, ObservabilityContext) instead.
      This can be called to record the end of a process that has errored. An error is when there is an unexpected problem that occurs in a process.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      throwable - the Throwable that occurred.
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • onProcessError

      default boolean onProcessError(String markerName, Throwable throwable, ObservabilityContext context)

      This can be called to record the end of a process that has errored. An error is when there is an unexpected problem that occurs in a process.

      The ObservabilityPluginImpl will log an error message without timing information. If integrated with DataDog, it will send metrics with tags as defined by ObservabilityContext.

      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      throwable - the invalid input: '{@link /*missing*/}' Throwable that occurred.
      context - ObservabilityContext
      Returns:
      true if a message is logged.

    • recordSetValue

      default void recordSetValue(String markerName, String aspect, String value, ObservabilityContext context)
      This can be called to record a set value for a marker, which tracks the number of unique values produced for a marker + aspect over a given period of time.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      aspect - the name of the metric, which will be combined with the marker name.
      value - the set value.
      context - ObservabilityContext

    • recordCount

      default void recordCount(String markerName, String aspect, long delta, ObservabilityContext context)
      This can be called to record a count delta, the change in count for a marker.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      aspect - the name of the metric, which will be combined with the marker name.
      delta - the change in count for this metric (usually 1).
      context - ObservabilityContext

    • recordDistributionValue

      default void recordDistributionValue(String markerName, String aspect, long value, ObservabilityContext context)
      This can be called to record a distribution value for a marker.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      aspect - the name of the metric, which will be combined with the marker name.
      value - the distribution value.
      context - ObservabilityContext

    • recordServiceCheck

      default void recordServiceCheck(String markerName, String aspect, ServiceCheckStatus status, ObservabilityContext context)
      This can be called to record a status check on the given service (markerName) and aspect.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker for this service.
      aspect - the name of the check, which will be combined with the marker name.
      status - the status of the service at this time.
      context - ObservabilityContext

    • recordGaugeValue

      default void recordGaugeValue(String markerName, String aspect, long value, ObservabilityContext context)
      This can be called to record a gauge value for a marker.
      Parameters:
      markerName - the name of the marker.
      aspect - the name of the metric, which will be combined with the marker name.
      value - the value of the gauge
      context - ObservabilityContext

    • flush

      default void flush()
      Flush monitoring data. This might be useful to make sure all metrics were sent to the backend
